intro: Blepharoglossum grossum, commonly known as the broad-leafed heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are broad and leathery, with a dense, compact growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
